title: Philemon 1:1
content: 1 Paul, a prisoner of Christ Jesus, and Timothy our brother, To Philemon our beloved fellow worker,

title: Philemon 1:2
content: 2 to Apphia our sister, to Archippus our fellow soldier, and to the church that meets at your house:

title: Philemon 1:3
content: 3 Grace and peace to you from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

title: Philemon 1:4
content: 4 I always thank my God, remembering you in my prayers,

title: Philemon 1:5
content: 5 because I hear about your faith in the Lord Jesus and your love for all the saints.

title: Philemon 1:6
content: 6 I pray that your partnership in the faith may become effective as you fully acknowledge every good thing that is ours in Christ.

title: Philemon 1:7
content: 7 I take great joy and encouragement in your love, because you, brother, have refreshed the hearts of the saints.

title: Philemon 1:8
content: 8 So although in Christ I am bold enough to order you to do what is proper,

title: Philemon 1:9
content: 9 I prefer to appeal on the basis of love. For I, Paul, am now aged, and a prisoner of Christ Jesus as well.

title: Philemon 1:10
content: 10 I appeal to you for my child Onesimus, whose father I became while I was in chains.

title: Philemon 1:11
content: 11 Formerly he was useless to you, but now he has become useful both to you and to me.

title: Philemon 1:12
content: 12 I am sending back to you him who is my very heart.

title: Philemon 1:13
content: 13 I would have liked to keep him with me, so that on your behalf he could minister to me in my chains for the gospel.

title: Philemon 1:14
content: 14 But I did not want to do anything without your consent, so that your goodness will not be out of compulsion, but by your own free will.

title: Philemon 1:15
content: 15 For perhaps this is why he was separated from you for a while, so that you might have him back for good—

title: Philemon 1:16
content: 16 no longer as a slave, but better than a slave, as a beloved brother. He is especially beloved to me, but even more so to you, both in person and in the Lord.

title: Philemon 1:17
content: 17 So if you consider me a partner, receive him as you would receive me.

title: Philemon 1:18
content: 18 But if he has wronged you in any way or owes you anything, charge it to my account.

title: Philemon 1:19
content: 19 I, Paul, write this with my own hand. I will repay it—not to mention that you owe me your very self.

title: Philemon 1:20
content: 20 Yes, brother, let me have some benefit from you in the Lord. Refresh my heart in Christ.

title: Philemon 1:21
content: 21 Confident of your obedience, I write to you, knowing that you will do even more than I ask.

title: Philemon 1:22
content: 22 In the meantime, prepare a guest room for me, because I hope that through your prayers I will be restored to you.

title: Philemon 1:23
content: 23 Epaphras, my fellow prisoner in Christ Jesus, sends you greetings,

title: Philemon 1:24
content: 24 as do Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, and Luke, my fellow workers.

title: Philemon 1:25
content: 25 The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit.
